ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Normal hearing
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Pure-tone thresholds are within normal limits (0-15 dB HL) bilaterally, with excellent word recognition scores and normal middle ear function.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess speech reception thresholds and word recognition ability.
To evaluate the acoustic reflex arc and rule out retrocochlear pathology.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The evaluation reveals normal hearing sensitivity bilaterally. Speech audiometry is consistent with pure-tone thresholds, showing excellent word recognition. Middle ear function is normal as evidenced by Type A tympanograms and robust acoustic reflexes with no decay.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Normal hearing sensitivity bilaterally (thresholds 0-15 dB HL). PTA is 3 dB HL in the right ear and 5 dB HL in the left ear.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRT (5 dB HL bilaterally) agrees with PTA. WRS is 100% at 50 dB HL bilaterally.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Normal Type A tympanograms bilaterally. Right: 1.2 mL volume, 0.5 mmho admittance. Left: 0.9 mL volume, 0.6 mmho admittance.

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Present and normal for ipsilateral and contralateral stimulation from 500 to 4,000 Hz. Reflex decay negative at 500 and 1,000 Hz.

proposed_items: Continue use of non-custom musician earplugs during practice
Consider custom musician earplugs if desired
counseling_actions: Counsel on hearing conservation and the importance of protecting hearing during music exposure
Discuss the benefits of custom versus non-custom earplugs

escalation.rationale_short: Patient has normal hearing; routine monitoring is recommended due to noise exposure risk.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor hearing status due to regular music exposure.
